post: Congratulations to Suraj Shah and Courtney Tetteh-Martey! Their project, Debate Discovery Kits, a student-led organization to expand access to speech and debate education, earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge. Learn about all our winners today!  https://bit.ly/4lP5P0u  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Star Spangled Tea, an affiliate partner of BRI, has over a dozen tea blends that have nods to historical figures and local flavors. Whether you're a history buff or a tea lover, use code 'BRI1791' to get a discount and support the Bill of Rights Institute with every purchase. A portion of your purchase helps us bring free civic education to classrooms nationwide. Visit  https://bit.ly/46ald2T to shop now.

Congratulations to Spencer Chaisanguanthum! His project, Eloquence Academy (EA ) a nonprofit organization that increases equitable public speaking and academic debate opportunities for historically underserved students through classes, tournaments, workshops, in-school programs, and online resources, earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge. Learn about all our winners today!  https://bit.ly/4lP5P0u  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Congratulations to Naomi Hsu! Her project, Step By Step Dance, a nonprofit organization devoted to empowering individuals with special needs through dance, earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge. Learn about all our winners today!  https://bit.ly/4lP5P0u  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

The Stepping Stones Group, LLC is seeking to revolutionize how school districts across the nation access special education solutions. We are grateful for their support of our Civics for Everyone initiative. Learn more about the initiative and how you can support the Institute!  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp

Congratulations to Chloe Cho! Her project, Solis and Luna Arts, a youth-led organization committed to making healthcare more attainable and human through the power of music, earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge. Learn about all our winners today!  https://bit.ly/4lP5P0u  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Congratulations to Naaya Talwar and Mahila Cheralathan of Cerritos High School, Cerritos, CA. Their project, Medical Mystery Camp - a youth-led initiative dedicated to early detection, health literacy, and empowering vulnerable patients earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge. Learn about all our winners today!  https://bit.ly/4lP5P0u  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Gerald Gangaram, VP of Civic Leadership Development at BRI, recently shared his story with Voice for Valor. A retired US Army Major and decorated Apache helicopter pilot, his journey from Queens, NY, to the Pentagon embodies the American spirit of perseverance and service. At BRI, he continues to serve by empowering students with the knowledge and skills to be active, informed citizens. Find out more about Gerald and his work in this video:  https://bit.ly/3GHov3r  #BillofRightsInstitute  #CivicLeadership  #VeteransInEducation

Congratulations to Leo Toake, Muhammad El-Sherbiny, Elle Kim, and Justin Ahn of Hackensack, NJ. Their ecology project won Third Prize in this year's MyImpact Challenge contest. They derived S. A. F. E. (Sustainable Allelopathic Field Eradication), a natural herbicide derived from food-waste allelochemicals to suppress invasive plant species without harming soil or water health. Find out more about their project in this video!  https://bit.ly/3GzBEeP  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

David Bobb, BRI's President, was recently quoted in a NY Times article on America's 250th birthday celebration: Lets try to make the 250th a time for rediscovering those [principles of the Declaration of Independence] and what they mean for the next 250 years.  Read more in the article:  https://nyti.ms/4lcfEWo
